title: macro_rules panic without parens

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
This code panic: 

``` rust
macro_rules! foo { panic => () }
```

I expected to see this happen: missing some paren error or whatnot.

Instead, this happened: rustc panic.

`rustc --version --verbose`:

```
rustc 1.0.0-beta.5 (7b4ef47b7 2015-05-11) (built 2015-05-11)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 7b4ef47b7805a402d756fb8157101f64880a522f
commit-date: 2015-05-11
build-date: 2015-05-11
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.0.0-beta.5
```

Backtrace:

```
panic.rs:2:1: 2:33 error: internal compiler error: wrong-structured lhs for follow check (didn't find a TtDelimited or TtSequence)
panic.rs:2 macro_rules! foo { panic => () }
           ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', /home/rustbuild/src/rust-buildbot/slave/beta-dist-rustc-linux/build/src/libsyntax/diagnostic.rs:149
```
